title: Mediaeater Digest
description: Latest links and resources - mediaeater - dispute the text

items.title: Computer scientist Yann LeCun: ‘Intelligence really is about learning’
items.content_text:
LeCun calls Wang, who was hired to lead the organisation, “young” and “inexperienced”.

“He learns fast, he knows what he doesn’t know . . . There’s no experience with research or how you practise research, how you do it. Or what would be attractive or repulsive to a researcher.”

Wang also became LeCun’s manager. I ask LeCun how he felt about this shift in hierarchy. He initially brushes it off, saying he’s used to working with young people. “The average age of a Facebook engineer at the time was 27. I was twice the age of the average engineer.”

But those 27-year-olds weren’t telling him what to do, I point out.

“Alex [Wang] isn’t telling me what to do either,” he says. “You don’t tell a researcher what to do. You certainly don’t tell a researcher like me what to do.”
items.summary:
LeCun calls Wang, who was hired to lead the organisation, “young” and “inexperienced”.

“He learns fast, he knows what he doesn’t know . . . There’s n...
items.content_html:
LeCun calls Wang, who was hired to lead the organisation, “young” and “inexperienced”. “He learns fast, he knows what he doesn’t know . . . There’s no experience with research or how you practise research, how you do it. Or what would be attractive or repulsive to a researcher.” Wang also became LeCun’s manager. I ask LeCun how he felt about this shift in hierarchy. He initially brushes it off, saying he’s used to working with young people. “The average age of a Facebook engineer at the time was 27. I was twice the age of the average engineer.” But those 27-year-olds weren’t telling him what to do, I point out. “Alex [Wang] isn’t telling me what to do either,” he says. “You don’t tell a researcher what to do. You certainly don’t tell a researcher like me what to do.”

Tags: ft, ai, meta, corporate-culture, research

items.title: What Will Happen In 2026
items.content_text:
(ed note, strong list, excellent track record) 1/ Gemini passes ChatGPT in terms of DAUs, MAUs, and tokens consumed in the first half of 2026, making Google the king of AI.

2/ The Democrats take control of the House in the Nov 2026 elections, bringing to an end Trump's complete control of the US government.

3/ Smartglasses finally reach product market fit in 2026, but it won't be Meta that delivers the winning approach.

4/ A majority of venture capital deals close without lawyers on either side due to standardized documents (like the NVCA ones) and AI tools for review and legal diligence. ..
